Title: Assistant Store Manager, Visual Merchandising, Wayfair Stores
RoleDescription:
Assistant Store Manager, Visual Merchandising
Location: 1801 Howell Mill Road, Atlanta, GA 30318
The salary range for this position is $57,000-$70,000 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
Overview:As a Visual Merchandising Assistant Store Manager (ASM), youll lead the charge in bringing the Wayfair brand to life in our physical retail store. Reporting to the Visual Merchandising Manager, youll play a pivotal role in shaping the in-store shopping experience by overseeing visual presentation, driving sales through merchandising strategies, and coaching a team of Visual Specialists and Sales Associates.
This position blends creativity and analytical insights, leveraging business data to craft compelling displays, execute merchandising initiatives, and optimize customer engagement. With your leadership, youll inspire your team to deliver seamless operations, innovative visual storytelling, and exceptional customer experiences.
The ideal candidate thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with expertise in visual merchandising, team development, and strategic planning. Join us in redefining the home retail experience and laying the foundation for the future of Wayfair-branded stores.
 
What Does a Visual Merchandising ASM Do?

 Lead Visual Excellence: Support the Retail Visual Merchandising Manager in training and developing associates on Wayfairs visual standards, floorset execution, adapting displays to inventory and sales trends, and executing tasks like marketing placement, lighting installations, wallpapering, and basic electrical wiring.
 Coach and Develop Teams: Provide strong leadership and professional maturity while giving actionable feedback and guidance to Visual Specialists, Sales, and Operations teams to drive business results and foster associate growth. Includes accountability conversations and coaching in-the-moment to ensure team alignment with Wayfair People Principles.
 Execute Visual Plans: Assist in planning and executing visual merchandising tasks, including floorsets, daily maintenance, flips, replenishment, signage placement, and value-added services (VAS).
 Drive Business Results: Combine passion for visual merchandising with business acumen and sales analytics to analyze trends and make data-driven decisions that contribute to store profitability and Wayfairs success.
 Foster Team Success: Build a high-performing team through professional and encouraging coaching to ensure tasks align with store objectives. Serve as a keyholder to help open or close the store as needed.
 Engage Customers with Confidence: Represent Wayfairs customer-first commitment by leveraging product knowledge to assist customers and collaborating with Retail Engagement teams to deliver an authentic and friendly shopping experience.
 Embrace Innovation: Bring energy and creativity by sharing ideas to improve operations within store guardrails, enhancing brand recognition, product presentation, and adapting to a fast-paced environment with evolving selection and promotions.
 Oversee Stock Management: Monitor inventory levels, ensure efficient merchandise processing and organization, and facilitate replenishment on the sales floor to maintain visual integrity.
 Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with other departments daily to deliver a seamless shopping experience that reflects Wayfairs brand values.
 Demonstrate Organizational Proficiency: Show strong skills in organization, planning, communication, and relationship management. Interpret and execute planograms and sales floor layouts effectively.
 Technical Aptitude: Learn and use software and technology effectively, including mobile apps, portable devices, Google Workspace, and Microsoft Office.


Youll Thrive in This Role if You Have:

 Leadership Experience: 1+ years leading a large team, with proven ability to motivate and develop high-performing associates.
 Visual Merchandising Expertise: 2+ years driving strong business results through visual merchandising and brand presentation in a retail or home furnishings environment.
 Retail Experience: 3+ years of retail experience, preferably in home, furnishing, or interior design spaces.
 Hands-On Skills: Comfort with basic electrical wiring, lighting installation, wallpapering, and furniture assembly.
 Schedule Flexibility: Willingness to work nights, weekends, and holidays as business needs require.
 Organizational Strength: Excellent planning, communication, and multitasking skills to manage shifting priorities.
 Data-Driven Decision-Making: Ability to use sales trends and inventory insights to optimize visual merchandising and product presentation.
 Collaborative Mindset: Strong relationship management skills and experience working cross-functionally to deliver seamless customer experiences.

Title: Workflow Controller
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $102,942.00-$113,778.00 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
 Workflow Controller 
 
The Workflow Controller plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.
 
What You'll Do

You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short-mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Communicate with cross-functional leadership
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements
Beyond optimizing plans and backlogs, you will also directly empower and lead a small, dedicated team of warehouse associates, fostering a high-performance environment and ensuring seamless execution of daily operations.
Provide leadership coverage, confidently supporting other teams, ensuring continuous operational excellence across the floor.

 
What You'll Need

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Preferred Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements

Title: Site Reliability Engineer I, Platforms
RoleDescription:
Who We Are:
Wayfair leads e-commerce for all things home, driven by modern tech. We seek sharp thinkers who design scalable systems while keeping a startup mindset. Our culture values fast, data-driven innovation.
The Wayfair Operations Center team is looking for experienced engineers skilled in cloud-native design, legacy maintenance, and SRE best practicesplus ideas for improvement! We collaborate across our Technology organization to ensure platforms and services are production-ready, contributing to both platform and software codebases.
What Youll Do:

As a Site Reliability Engineer, you will join our team to help grow our systems into best-in-class for efficiency, stability, observability, velocity, and scale in the e-commerce space, engage with the product and engineering team from Day 1 to design, build and maintain the system/software proactively.
Influence the design and architecture of Wayfair system as part of our Cloud Enablement journey while maintaining our critical pieces of legacy tools; collaborate with development teams to design scalable and reliable systems, considering aspects such as fault tolerance, availability and performance.
Be the bridge between software engineers and platform engineers to develop and optimize repeatable systems so each side can leverage each other. Theres a wide range of opportunities to both guide the broad conversation and dive into the nuance of our code & architecture.
Help service owners build realistic SLOs, set SLAs and error budgets, and ensure production services have reliability built into their design.Even after self-healing and automation done by you  provide production support and creatively solve challenging engineering problems across our stack.
Participate in the team's on-call rotation.
Automate repetitive tasks to increase efficiency and reduce human error.
Mentor new hires and other engineers by example. Opportunities to lead tech talks, paired programming sessions, and more to increase technical efficiency across the organization.

What Youll Need:

2 years experience working in DevOps or SRE role, or software development with an understanding of Cloud Infrastructure.
Experience with cloud platforms GCP, AWS, Azure, and containerization technologies (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience with server-side software engineering (Python, Go, Java, BASH, etc)
Design experience with distributed systems, microservices architecture, and related technologies.
Strong understanding of monitoring and alerting, with a focus on performance monitoring and tracing instrumentation & SLI/SLO/SLAs.
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and version control systems (e.g., Buildkite, Github Actions, Gitlab CI/CD).
Knowledge of configuration management tools (e.g. Puppet, Ansible, Chef, Terraform).
Excellent communication skills across engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders alike.
Passion for leading a large, cross-cutting technical initiative to delivery, cross-functional consensus building and influencing design decisions.
Ample experience gathering and balancing requirements from technical and business stakeholders, and reaching consensus on prioritization.
Experience mentoring engineers and leading code reviews.
Proven track record decoupling monolith services is a plus.

Title: Senior Marketing Analyst
RoleDescription:
Senior Marketing AnalystLondon, UK | Office-Based (MonThurs, Fri-WFH)Full-Time
Benefits: Wayfair Employee Discount, Private Medical Care, Dental Care, Gym Membership Reimbursement, Tuition Reimbursement, 25 Days Starting Holiday + Bank Holidays (with tenure increases), Pension, Cycle to Work scheme, and more.
Salary: The salary range for this position is 51,000 - 57,750 per year, however the base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
Wayfair & The Role
Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, Wayfair makes it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of millions of items across home furnishings, dcor, home improvement, housewares and more. Committed to delighting its customers every step of the way, Wayfair is reinventing the way people shop for their homes - from product discovery to final delivery.We are looking for a Senior Analyst  B2B Marketing with 3+ years of experience to manage and optimize our B2B marketing activities (i.e. Paid Search, Email marketing). This role is perfect for a data-driven professional with strong analytical and technical skills, capable of executing and leading initiatives to drive growth.
You will work closely with internal teams (Marketing channels, Category Management, Martech, Data Science, Engineering) to enhance performance and drive efficiency. The ideal candidate has experience with B2B marketing, bidding strategies, audience segmentation, and attribution modeling while understanding what B2B customers need to further tailor and optimize our B2B marketing activities.
What You'll Do


Manage and optimize B2B marketing activities across various marketing channels (i.e. Paid Search, email) ensuring alignment with business objectives.


Analyze, identify and prioritize the most promising acquisition and brand growth levers, based on data and market trends


Build and scale user acquisition strategies across all marketing areas such as influencers, content, brand activations, partnerships, and more

Drive deep analysis of our acquisition funnels, user behavior, and LTV:CAC dynamics to spot opportunities and optimize ROI

Manage cross functional projects to further drive growth of our B2B customer base


Work with Data Science and Martech teams to refine machine learning-based bidding strategies, automation, and attribution models.

Stay ahead of platform updates, privacy regulations, and measurement changes, including GA4, server-side tracking, and first-party data strategies.

What Youll Bring


Demonstrable of experience in B2B marketing

Strong analytical and technical skills, with experience in Excel (advanced), SQL, Looker, Tableau, Python, or R.

Knowledge of incrementality testing, attribution modeling, and marketing automation.


Strong business acumen, with the ability to translate insights into actionable optimizations.

Bachelors degree in Marketing, Business, Data Analytics, or related field (Masters preferred) or qualified by experience

Understanding of the evolving privacy and measurement landscape, including GA4, first-party data, and server-side tracking.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Returns Optimization
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $121,000 - 132,000. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
Must be ONSITE in Boston, MA (Monday-Thursday)
CastleGate is Wayfairs proprietary supply chain service that empowers suppliers to forward-position their inventory closer to customers, enabling fast, reliable, and cost-effective fulfillment. The CastleGate Product team is part of Wayfairs broader Network Management organization and is responsible for building and optimizing the CastleGate offering across our global network to ensure it creates value for Wayfair, our Suppliers and Customers.
We're seeking a passionate and skilled Data Scientist to be a core member of the team building our groundbreaking Returns Disposition Engine. In this role, you'll be instrumental in developing and deploying optimization models for the Wayfair returns process. You'll work with complex data to determine the best course of action for each returned item, balancing company, supplier, and customer interests. This is an opportunity to use your technical expertise to solve a critical business problem, directly impacting our operational efficiency, financial outcome and customer satisfaction. Successful individuals in this role excel at both qualitative and quantitative analysis while also being eager to communicate upward and outward to tell a concise story.  
What You'll Do

Leverage arithmetic, statistical, and ML approaches to establish a new profit max Returns Disposition Engine
Perform statistical analysis across large data sets and within defined segments to develop performance insights across a myriad of attributes
Create efficient data structures that can be leveraged across the organization and can be maintained in a dynamic environment
Collaborate with cross functional partners and ensure that there is strong alignment between Wayfairs business objectives and our Data Science driven strategies
Develop key metrics and reporting to measure how initiatives are improving Wayfairs performance and enabling our team to easily identify trends, root causes and develop targeted action plans
Conduct thorough ad-hoc analysis
Build prototypes and dashboards to translate large data sets into driving insights and action
Monitor KPIs and assess how were making progress against business objectives

What You'll Need 

Master's and/or Bachelors degree in a quantitative field
Professional experience in writing code in structured programming languages (Python, R), writing scripts using GBQ or SQL, creating Pivot Tables and Vlookups in Google Sheets or Excel, and using data visualization tools such as Data Studio, Looker, Tableau or PowerBI
Excellent communication, both written and verbally
Collaborative mindset that thrives as part of a team
Data and process-oriented, demonstrated ability to continuously learn new tools
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
Ability to navigate an environment of continuous improvement working through ambiguity in an evolving organization 

An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy:
All Boston-based interns, Co-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday - Thursday, and work remotely Friday.

Title: Warehouse Supervisor
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $62,500 - $68,000 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
Schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, Fri 8:30 am - 7 pm
We are Wayfair; we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customers needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. Title: Store Manager, Joss & Main Burlington
RoleDescription:
Location: 75 Middlesex Turnpike Space # 1400, Burlington, MA 01803
The salary range for this position is $79,650- $97,350, however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Bonuses may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.
Brief Overview of Position:
Come join the team that is reinventing home! We are hiring a Store Manager for our Joss & Main retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, this store might be the future home for your career.
What youll do:

As an authentic brand ambassador for the Wayfair family, lead and create a best in class customer experience by connecting them with the world's biggest and best home online assortment brought to life in our stores.
Master our brand story and be able to share our brand with polished communication and professionalism.
Handle impromptu visitation from the press, investors or other key stakeholders.
Provide leadership to the team and meet or exceed budgeted sales, payroll, and controllable expense goals.
Maintain leadership presence through effective floor management and resource allocation.
Ignite an on-brand design space utilizing all of our design and omni-channel tools and services to bring our customers design aspirations to life.
Guide customers through their questions on product features and functionality, style and product coordination, and cutting requests, including in-store assortment and endless aisle.
Motivate and train all associates in sales, customer service, operations, and product knowledge, utilizing all resources.
Lead the use of utilization design tools, CRM software and client accounts for consistent customer experience and record keeping.  
Foster and instill a culture of accountability and continuous feedback to promote a profitable, positive, and dynamic environment.
Consistently recruit, hire, and retain a salesforce that delights and inspires our customers while driving sales and providing design advice.
Identify talents and develop skills within the team to enable succession planning.
Perform opening and closing routines and provide supervision to ensure the store is meeting financial goals and associates are providing best in class service to our customers. 
Effectively manage store operations, maintain appropriate inventory levels, and maintain visual merchandising standards.
Utilize sales analytics tools to drive store profitability and growth in a way that supports the success of the overall brand.
Develop, lead, and deliver a long-term sustainable plan for growth, visitation and profitability in the market.
Outreach and prospect new B2C and B2B clientele.

Lead a team to always use good judgment by demonstrating a culture of ethical conduct, security, and compliance.

5+ years of management experience in a specialty retail and/or multi-unit retail business environment.  Interior design, furniture or home goods experience preferred.
Exceptional analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Proven ability to motivate, influence and inspire yourself and others.
Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment.
Technical acumen to learn necessary software; experience with Google Cloud G Suite, including Docs, Sheets, Slides, and Forms preferred.
Ability to process information and merchandise through a computer system and POS register system. 
Full time associates may need to work nights, weekends, and holidays on a rotating basis. 

Essential Functions:

On-site presence at a physical location.
Excellent verbal communication skills.
Excellent active listening skills.
Excellent sales and customer service skills.
Extensive knowledge of the merchandise sold.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.

Title: Senior Retail Designer, Cabinetry
RoleDescription:
Senior Retail Designer, Cabinetry
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091The entry pay for this position is $25/hr with uncapped quarterly bonus pay potential. Total compensation may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
Overview:At Wayfair, we believe a home should be as functional as it is beautiful and that starts with great design. As a Sr. Retail Designer of Cabinetry and Home Renovation, you'll turn customer visions into reality, guiding them through their renovation journey with confidence, creativity, and care. From kitchens and bathrooms to laundry rooms and custom built-ins, you'll craft smart, stylish spaces that reflect each customers goals, budget, and style.
Youll tap into your expertise in cabinetry, bath, and kitchen design. Youll lean into Wayfairs expansive product catalog from cabinetry and tile to flooring and plumbing to provide complete solutions for DIY homeowners and professional contractors alike. If you're a proactive problem-solver with a passion for design and sales, and you love seeing a great project come to life, this is your stage.
What Does A Cabinetry and Home Renovation Designer Do?

 Own the Design Process: Lead cabinetry and home renovation projects from concept to completion. Use 2020 Design Live or similar software to develop layout plans, renderings, and product recommendations based on customer inputs, measurements, and needs.
 Be the Technical Expert: Educate customers on cabinetry construction types (framed vs. frameless), materials (MDF, plywood, solid wood), finishes (painted, stained, laminated), and specialty features (soft-close hinges, pull-outs, and more).
 Deliver Personalized Consultations: Whether it's in-store, virtual, or in-home, you'll meet customers where they are. You'll listen deeply, learn their style and renovation goals, and recommend functional, beautiful solutions tailored to their timeline and budget.
 Connect the Dots from Start to Finish: Develop floor plans, mood boards, 3D visuals, and complete product packages. You'll manage each projects full lifecycle, from early design to final purchase, and offer support through post-order services to ensure a smooth renovation experience.
 Educate + Inspire: Stay ahead of design trends and new materials, bringing fresh ideas to every customer interaction. Help customers see how tile, flooring, kitchen, bath, and plumbing products can work together to create the space theyve dreamed of.
 Leverage Design + Sales Tools: Use analytics and digital tools to build persuasive space plans, presentations, and shopping experiences that help grow the business while putting your creativity to work.
 Thrive in a Dynamic Environment: With evolving customer needs, product assortments, and promotions, youll stay focused, flexible, and ready to pivotall while delivering high-impact experiences.
 Always Be Selling (ABS): Every interaction is an opportunity. Youll generate new leads, build customer rapport, and close on personalized solutions that help grow your pipeline and the stores performance.
 Contribute to Store Success: Help with visual updates, floor sets, and inventory tasks as needed and bring your ideas to the table! Were a team that builds (and wins) together.

 
Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Design Experience: 3+ years of experience in kitchen, bath, cabinetry, or home renovation design. You know your way around spatial planning, product selection, and what works (and what wows). Bonus points for 12 years focused on cabinetry.
 Technical Proficiency: Youre confident working in 2020 Design software. Familiarity with CRM/POS systems (like Salesforce) helps too.
 Sales Know-How: Youve got a track record of meeting or beating your sales goals and you know how to build trust while selling big ideas and beautiful designs.
 Flexible Schedule: Retail hours mean nights, weekends, and holidays. Youre ready to show up when your customers need you most.
 Educational Background: A Bachelors degree or college diploma in a related field is preferred, but your experience and design sensibility speak volumes.
 Leadership + Training Experience: If youve mentored or trained others in a retail or design setting, even better! You know how to lift up your team and lead by example.
 Professional Certification (Preferred): NKBA, NAHB, NARI, or KBDI certifications are a plus and help you stand out as a true renovation pro.
 End-to-End Product Knowledge: You bring the full package from cabinetry to tile and have the confidence to guide customers through every step.
 Collaborative Spirit: You thrive in a team-focused environment and take pride in supporting your peers just as much as your customers.
 Top-Notch Organization: Strong attention to detail, follow-through, and communication make you a trusted partner from consultation to completion.

Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

 Physical Activity: Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
 Mobility & Movement: Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
 Lifting Ability: Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly.
 Vision Requirements: Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
 Temperature Flexibility: Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
 Noise Tolerance: Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
 Safety Awareness: Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazardsmust adhere to all safety protocols.

 
What are the Benefits*?

 Competitive Pay & Bonus: Earn competitive compensation with regular opportunities for performance-based increases and substantial quarterly bonus opportunity. 
 Career Growth: Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
 Health Benefits from Day One: Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
 Time to Recharge: Start accruing paid time off immediatelybecause work-life balance matters.
 401(k) with Company Match: Well match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
 Tuition Reimbursement: Eligible after 6 months of employmentlearn, grow, and get support along the way.
 Wayfair Employee Discount: Save big on the pieces you loveplus get 10% off at our in-store restaurant .
 Parental Leave Options: Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.
 And So Much More: Weve got more good stuff where that came from! NOTE: our full-time roles receive the full benefits package above, while part-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in-store team can help with any questions!

Title: Retail Inventory Specialist, Full-Time - Perigold Luxury
RoleDescription:
Retail Inventory Specialist
Location: West Palm Beach, Florida
 
Brief Overview of Position
Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first-of-their-kind retail destinations of 20-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories.  Come be a part of it!  We are looking for a Logistics Lead to oversee all back of house store operations, and report directly into the Store Manager.  If you are driven, collaborative, and determined with strong attention to detail and communication skills and thrive on constant learning and dynamic challenges, this may be the perfect fit.
 
What youll do 

Maintain luxury experience standards by supporting an authentic, inviting guest experience that exemplifies our commitment to customer satisfaction and passion for luxury design.
Oversee full store inventory accuracy, all inbound and outbound flows, all store replenishment, and fulfillment.
Support the Store Manager and team with receiving and stockroom organization and supply levels to maximize inventory accuracy, inventory reconciliation and restocking efficiency, safety and productivity to support sales floor replenishment, returns and other related processes.

Title: Operations Manager - EU Freight
RoleDescription:
Office Based: Lutterworth Magna ParkHours: 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday
Salary: The salary range for this position is 68,000 - 75,750 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
Company Benefits: Wayfair Employee Discount, Private Medical Care, Dental Care, Gym Membership,  Tuition Reimbursement, 25 Days starting Holiday (with tenure entitlement) + Bank Holidays, Pension, Cycle to Work scheme amongst others.
Revolutionise global freight operations and lead the charge in optimising Wayfair's logistics! 
CastleGate Forwarding (CGF) is a rapidly growing digital freight forwarding startup within Wayfair. We're dedicated to moving containers globally, from Wayfair suppliers to our shelves and beyond. We provide a full suite of shipping services, including consolidation in Asia, ocean freight, drayage, customs brokerage, and cargo insurance. Our goal is to offer Wayfair suppliers efficient and competitive logistics solutions. We leverage our proprietary end-to-end logistics network to enhance speed, quality, and cost efficiency.
As an Operations Manager will be a key leader in our organization, responsible for steering the team that manages and optimizes our inbound freight operations and procurement strategy. Your primary focus will be to oversee carrier relationships, negotiate contracts, and improve operational efficiencies. You will be instrumental in driving cost savings and ensuring we consistently deliver high service levels. This role requires exceptional leadership, analytical problem-solving abilities, and a strategic approach to enhance transportation and procurement performance in the European market.
What Youll Do:
Leadership & Strategy

Manage a team of logistics professionals, providing coaching and career development.
Drive operational excellence by owning financial performance and executing strategic initiatives to enhance efficiency and reduce costs.
Collaborate with key stakeholders across departments to ensure operational success and service quality.

Freight Forwarding & Carrier Management

Develop and implement carrier strategies for inbound freight to ensure both cost-effectiveness and reliability. Stay current on market trends, pricing, and new logistics solutions to maintain a competitive edge.
Continuously track and improve carrier performance using key metrics like cost, transit times, and service levels.
Manage and lead the negotiation of contracts and service level agreements with drayage providers.

Procurement & Vendor Management

Oversee the entire procurement process, including vendor selection, contract negotiation, and risk mitigation related to supplier reliability and cost volatility.
Develop and maintain strong, long-term partnerships with carriers to ensure competitive pricing and a reliable supply chain.
Implement systems to track costs and measure performance, driving continuous improvement in the procurement process.

Technology & Process Optimization

Partner with Technology and Business Intelligence teams to utilize data, automation, and reporting tools.
Create and deploy carrier and procurement dashboards to track performance and pinpoint areas for improvement, while also standardizing and automating processes to enhance efficiency.

What You Bring:

Demonstrable experience in logistics, supply chain or operations management, with a track record of successfully managing carrier partnerships and performance.
Proven experience managing and developing teams, with a focus on fostering a high-performance culture.
Analytical and data-driven mindset, with the ability to translate insights into actionable strategies 
Excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills, with a structured approach to tackling operational challenges.
Proven ability in negotiation and vendor management, adept at resolving complex issues and fostering collaborative relationships that drive mutual success.
Proficiency in Google or Microsoft Suite and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio, Looker, Tableau or Power BI. Any SQL/GBQ knowledge is a plus.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, with experience leading cross-functional initiatives.

Additional Requirements 

Have the flexibility of regular travel to our London office at least once a month.

Although Logistics, supply chain, or operations management experience is essential, any additional knowledge of procurement, freight forwarding, drayage, or ocean carrier management would be a plus.

RoleDescription:
The CastleGate Inbound, Operations Services Associate role is part of our Global Partner Support Inbound team. As a member of GPS Inbound you will work with internal teams and our Fulfillment Centers to provide best in class support to our suppliers that are shipping items to ports and onto our Wayfair Facilities, known as CastleGate. Use critical thinking to review documentation against credit requests to effectively determine the outcome of claims
Triage tickets to understand if it needs to be routed to other internal teams or escalated to our Tier II team.
Identify areas of opportunity within our SOPs. 
Meet deadlines and SLAs, proactively adjusting, learning, and communicating when roadblocks are encountered or new information becomes available

Associates degree or equivalent military/work experience
Skill at time management and prioritization, working well under tight SLAs

Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems
Strong organization skills and attention to detail
Ability to work effectively with people in a cross-functional environment
Confidence as a self-starter, able to work with limited supervision
Passion for solving complex business problems 
Experience with collaborative G Suite tools or their Microsoft/Open Office equivalents
Adaptability to constant evolution of workload, processes and expectations
Ability to learn new systems and processes quickly 
Must be able to consider multiple approaches and not be limited by how things were done historically
